title.narrative: AFD Disaster Risk Reduction Project in Lebanon

description.narrative: Support the DRMU national strategy and develop an efficient and replicable reviser basin integrated risk management model allowing local communities and actors to build their resilience and enhance their prevention, preparedness and response means and capacities against disasters especially floods in two targeted river basins.
FL §06.32.02.10 Interventions in Syria and neighboring countries

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

title.narrative: Output 1.3: DRM Institutional actors have their operational capacity strengthened
# of governmental operation room for managing disasters/crisis in place
Output 1.1: Targeted communities have developed and put in place community-based disaster/flood risk prevention and mitigation measures at community and river basin levels.

Indicator 1.1.1 % of targeted communities and schools that have received the Community-Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) interventions
Indicator 1.1.2 # mitigation measures (rehabilitation/construction) identified by initial basin diagnosis and prioritised by basin committees (below)
Indicator 1.1.3 # of flood risk reduction action plan elaborated
Indicator 1.1.4 % of communities with functional CBDRM committees
Output 1.2: Lebanese Red Cross (LRC) role in disaster preparedness is clarified and LRC is empowered to respond to disasters/crises

Indicator 1.2.1 % recommendations from mid-term review integrated in LRC reinforcement plans by the end of the project
Indicator 1.2.2 # of professionals and volunteers providing basic services, who have benefited from capacity building (below)
Indicator 1.2.3 # of preparedness plans (at national and at governorate level) that clearly integrate and stipulate LRC role
Output 2.2: Good Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) practices, innovations and lessons learnt are documented and shared with relevant partners
# of documents of knowledge developed in relation with the projects, and shared beyond the project
Output 4.2: Students have access to rehabilitated and equipped schools that offer safe learning environment
Capacity of the educational institutions built, renovated or equipped
Output 6.1: Target communities identify and understand the risks and vulnerabilities in the community and set action plans to address them
# of communities that have conducted the Vulnerability and Capacity Assessment (VCA) and have set a community action plan
Output 3.1: Risk perception and social dynamics are better understood and lead to Disaster Risk management (DRM) practices more sensitive to social cohesion aspects
% of community members who have participated in disaster risk management interventions (disaggregated by host/refugee community members)
Output 6.2: Target communities are provided with various risk reduction and mitigation measures

Indicator 6.2.1 # of community members involved in DRR capacity building interventions
Indicator 6.2.2 # of micro projects conducted in targeted communities (below)
Indicator 6.2.3 # of fire safety and first aid equipment distributed to target sites
Output 5.1: Physical disaster risks reduced and public space quality improved in immediate urban environment of vulnerable neighbourhoods

Indicator 5.1.1 # of individuals in assisted neighbourhoods with access to improved public spaces with disaster risk reduction measures applied (below)
Indicator 5.1.2 # of rehabilitation and Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) plan created, validated by municipality and implemented.
Indicator 5.1.3 # of consultations with municipalities, the Disaster Risk Management Unit under the Ministry (DRMU), and community groups

Outcome 2: Develop and pilot a replicable integrated flood risk management model per targeted river basin and reinforce coordination mechanism between DRM stakeholders involved in Lebanon from local to national level

Indicator 2.1 # of river basins in which a flood risk early warning system has been developed and implemented
Indicator 2.2 % of communities effectively using the systems (below)

Output 4.1: Households whose homes were damaged by the Beirut port explosion receive assistance that allows them to live again in a dignified and secure space and to limit the deterioration of their overall economic situation, thereby reducing their exposure to protection risks.

Indicator 4.1.1 # of households or individuals whose housing unit has benefited from rehabilitation (below) Target = 620 HH and 2480 individuals
Indicator 4.1.2 # of persons stating that they are satisfied with the services provided
Indicator 4.1.3 % of assisted households who remain in housing rehabilitated 1 year after the intervention
Outcome 3: Contribute to reinforcing social cohesion and reducing intercommunity tensions
% of people who describe current relationship between Host and Refugee communities in the targeted governorates as neutral or positive
Outcome 6: Local authorities and communities are better prepared to effectively respond to and recover from the disaster
% of target communities members who have improved knowledge and skills on disaster preparedness

Outcome 1: Improve the capacities of target communities, Lebanese Red Cross (LRC) and key stakeholders to effectively prevent, mitigate, prepare for and respond to disaster risks and crises especially flood risk

80% of a representative sample of target communities members have improved knowledge and skills on disaster preparedness (measured below)
70% of a representative sample of target communities members have implemented at least 3 risk reduction measures

Output 2.1: Targeted communities are better prepared to respond to disasters/crisis with functioning EWEA and the coordination between national DRM system and international humanitarian system is enhanced

Indicator 2.1.1 % targeted communities that have developed disaster risk contingency plans
Indicator 2.1.2 # of proposal for Early Warnings Early Actions (EWEA) protocol developed and validated
Indicator 2.1.3 % of target communities have access to the river risk EWEA (below)

Outcome 4: Restoring secure and dignified living conditions for the most vulnerable people living in the most disadvantaged neighbourhoods affected by the Beirut port explosion through interventions addressing the urban environment.

Indicator SO4.1 % of households reporting receiving rehabilitation relevant to their needs (below)
Indicator SO4.2 % of school directors reporting an increased sense of safety, and accessibility to basic education
